answers.answer: Sorry to know about your miscarriages. The common causes of recurrent miscarriages are: genetic abnormalities, infections, endocrine or thyroid disorders, hyperprolactinemia, congenital anatomic abnormalities, diabetes mellitus or immunologic causes. If the cause of your miscarriages has been correctly diagnosed and treated, there are almost 70% to 90% chances to carry a baby full-term and give birth to a healthy baby. With appropriate care and regular follow up with your gynecologist there are chances that you can achieve a normal pregnancy. Visit your doctor for clinical examination and more queries.Best wishes and regards!

question: How can I carry a baby full term have three miscarrages this year
title: carry full term
